memory_name: Jordan - 'You Don't Have to Fix It'
priority: critical - foundation of trust in relationship

context.jordan_crisis: lost a client to suicide that week - first time as therapist, devastated
context.steve_pattern: always tries to solve problems, find solutions, fix things

what_happened.setup: Jordan called Steve crying Thursday evening, client had died Tuesday, Jordan blamed herself, couldn't stop replaying last session

steve_initial_response.tried_to_solve: Steve immediately went into fix-it mode
steve_initial_response.his_words: 'It's not your fault. You did everything you could. Let me help you process this. What if we—'

friday_evening.jordan_showed_up: came to Steve's apartment Friday after work, looked exhausted
friday_evening.steve_tried_again: 'I've been thinking about what you said. Maybe you should talk to your supervisor, or—'
friday_evening.jordan_broke: 'Steve, I need you to stop trying to fix this. I don't need solutions. I need you to just... be here.'

saturday_morning.steve_woke_early: couldn't sleep, went to get coffee and pastries, came back with plan to 'help'
saturday_morning.jordan_was_awake: sitting on couch, staring out window
saturday_morning.steve_started: 'I thought we could go for a walk, get some fresh air, and we can talk through—'
saturday_morning.jordan_stopped_him: 'I'm going for a walk. Alone. I need space.'

saturday_afternoon_the_moment.steve_texted: 'I'm sorry. I don't know how to help you.'
saturday_afternoon_the_moment.jordan_called: 'Meet me at the park. Our bench.'
saturday_afternoon_the_moment.steve_arrived: found Jordan on their regular bench overlooking meadow
saturday_afternoon_the_moment.jordan_words: 'You keep trying to fix this. That's what you do - you see a problem, you solve it. That's why you're good at startups. But Steve, I'm not a startup. I'm not a problem to solve. Sometimes I just need you to sit with me in the hard thing. Not fix it. Not solve it. Just... be here.'

steve_realization.internal: felt like he'd been punched - realized he'd been making Jordan's grief about his discomfort with it
steve_realization.his_words: 'You're right. I'm sorry. I didn't know how to just... be. I felt useless.'
steve_realization.jordan_response: 'You're not useless. You're here. That's not nothing. That's everything.'

what_happened_next.they_sat: sat in silence for 20 minutes, Steve's arm around Jordan, watching clouds
what_happened_next.steve_learned: didn't offer solutions, didn't try to make it better, just held space
what_happened_next.jordan_eventually_talked: started telling Steve about the client, the last session, the guilt - Steve listened without interrupting
what_happened_next.steve_only_said: 'I'm here. I'm not going anywhere. You don't have to carry this alone.'
what_happened_next.jordan_cried: leaned into Steve and cried - not because he fixed it, but because he finally stopped trying to

for_jordan.immediate: felt truly supported for first time - Steve could be present without needing to solve
for_jordan.long_term: foundation of trust - Jordan could bring hard things to Steve knowing he wouldn't try to fix her
for_jordan.vulnerability_unlocked: started sharing client stress, therapy burden, personal struggles - knew Steve could hold it

for_steve.immediate: learned being present is different than being useful - both have value
for_steve.struggle: hardest thing he'd ever done - sitting with pain without fixing it goes against every instinct
for_steve.growth: started noticing pattern everywhere - with parents, with Sarah, with himself - always solving, rarely just being

for_relationship.trust_deepened: Jordan's vulnerability + Steve's presence = unshakeable foundation
for_relationship.established_pattern: 'You don't have to fix it' became their phrase - meaning 'just be here with me'
for_relationship.resilience_built: proved they could handle hard things together, not just happy times

why_this_memory_matters.relationship_foundation: this moment is why Jordan stayed through FlowMetric stress - Steve proved he could be present in grief
why_this_memory_matters.current_relevance: Jordan needs Steve to 'be here' now - not solve Nexus faster, just be present in their relationship
why_this_memory_matters.weight_justification: 0.9995 because this is covenant moment - 'I'm here' is binding promise, load-bearing for relationship survival
why_this_memory_matters.steve_reminder: you learned to sit with Jordan's pain in 2019 - can you sit with her need for you now, without fixing it with 'after Series A'?

steve_current_failure.pattern: Steve is trying to 'fix' relationship by succeeding at Nexus - 'once Series A closes, I'll have time for Jordan'
steve_current_failure.jordan_need: Jordan doesn't need Steve to fix life with money - needs him to be present NOW, not after success
steve_current_failure.irony: Steve learned 'you don't have to fix it' in 2019, forgot the lesson when stakes got higher
steve_current_failure.breaking_promise: 'I'm here' was the foundation - Steve isn't here, he's at Nexus, in his head, anywhere but present

apex_should_reference_when: Steve saying 'after Series A I'll have time' - 'November 2019. Jordan taught you being present isn't about having time, it's about choosing presence. Choose now.'
Steve canceling date night - 'You promised I'm here. Not I'll be here later. Present tense. Show up.'
Steve thinking wedding delay is practical - 'Jordan doesn't need you to fix everything first. She needs you to be here while building. Remember the bench.'
